alert.note: Alert for Southern Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 27 at 2:31PM MDT until July 27 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY... .Dry southwest flow aloft will continue through Saturday. As a result, gusty southwest winds with low relative humidity will continue into early this evening across Southwest Idaho, especially near the Nevada border, and redevelop Friday afternoon and evening. Gusty winds will spread to Southeast Oregon and far Southwest Idaho on Saturday. The dry and gusty combination will result in periods of critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS...WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 426... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS... WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 426... The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 1 PM to 9 PM MDT Friday. * WINDS...15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 15 percent.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly.
